name.en: College of Information and Computing Sciences

history.en:
The College of Information and Computing Sciences is one of the premier colleges in the province for IT Education and services. It aims to produce competitive IT professionals and IT-enabled individuals who will encourage real innovation for the advancement in the digital era of the province and the country as a whole.
The college was established in 1998 at MSC Boac Campus through BOT Resolution No. 35, s. 1998 as Institute of Information and Computing Sciences (IICS), a special program to offer Associate in Computer Technology (ACT). Believing that the province needs IT Human Resources, after two years, IICS was adopted as the School of Information and Computing Sciences (SICS), offering two emerging degree programs Bachelor of Science in Information Management and Bachelor of Science in Information Technology to cater to the graduates of ACT. Bachelor of Science in Information Management was also offered in Sta. Cruz Campus. The Bachelor of Science in Information Management (BSIM) was renamed to the Bachelor of Science in Information Systems (BSIS) to adapt to CHED Memorandum Order No. 53 series of 2006.
After a decade, the Marinduque State College had an organizational restructuring wherein two of the big schools in the college were merged. The School of Industrial Technology and the School of Information and Computing Sciences convergence paved the way for the School of Technology's birth in 2016. After three years of being together, the two schools parted ways due to another organizational restructuring and SICS was re-birth in 2019.
In 2021, however, SICS was converted to the Institute of Information Systems and Technology (IIST) and became part of the College of Engineering, Information and Industrial Technology (CEIIT) together with the Institute of Engineering and Department of Industrial Technology to centralize the resources of these three into a single college. But once again, fate has plans for this institute and let it navigate its ship on its own. Finally, the former school was converted into a college, banning the name of the College of Information and Computing Sciences (CICS).
In 25 years of its existence, CICS has contributed significantly to MSC's mandates in Instruction, Research, Extension, and Production. Currently, both the BS in Information Systems and BS in Information Technology in Boac Campus are Level III Re-Accredited by the Accrediting Agency of Chartered Colleges and Universities in the Philippines (AACCUP), while the BS in Information Systems in Sta. Cruz Campus is Level II Re-Accredited. CICS has produced thousands of IT professionals serving in the province, other parts of the country, and even the global industry. Faculty and students are also actively engaged in research through various local and international presentations and publications. CICS also serves the community by providing relevant extension projects and activities.
For the years to come, CICS still commits to giving what their stakeholders deserve through quality education and public service with their mantra, 'WORK IN SILENCE AND LET OUR SUCCESS MAKE OUR NOISE!'

goals.en: To produce competitive IT professionals and IT enabled individuals who will encourage real innovation for the advancement in the digital era of the province and the country as a whole.

objectives.en:
To provide quality education in Information and Computing Sciences that will produce globally competitive graduates.
To conduct relevant research in Information and Computing Sciences that will contribute to the advancement of knowledge and technology.
To extend services to the community through information and computing sciences that will uplift the quality of life of the people.

title.en: National Digital Challenge - 1st Place

description.en: Pollux Rey won the 1st Place in the National Digital Challenge 2024, showcasing their innovative solutions and technical expertise in the field of information technology.

title.en: DANGAL 2024 - Best Extension Program - CICS TechnoHub

description.en: The CICS TechnoHub, a collaborative initiative providing technology support and training to local communities, was recognized as the Best Extension Program at the DANGAL 2024 Awards.

title.en: AACCUP Level III Re-Accreditation

description.en: The Bachelor of Science in Information Systems and Bachelor of Science in Information Technology programs achieved Level III Re-Accreditation from the Accrediting Agency of Chartered Colleges and Universities in the Philippines (AACCUP).

title.en: MARSU Conducts Its 69th Annual Commencement Exercise Class 2025

description.en: The Marinduque State University (MARSU) held its 69th Annual Commencement Exercise for the Class of 2025 on June 14, 2025, at the MSC Boac Campus.

content.en: As we look back on this special day, we honor the graduates of the College of Information and Computing Sciences, those who pushed through every challenge, stayed up late to finish projects, and kept going even when things got tough this moment is proof that all the hard work was worth it. From sleepless nights to moments of victory, they finally made it !.

title.en: A Legendary Send-off

description.en: A legendary send-off for the graduating class of 2025.

content.en:
It’s never easy to say goodbye to people who helped shape what a team truly means.
To our graduates — thank you. You were more than your roles. You were the ones behind the camera, behind the sketches, behind the sound checks. You were there when things got tough, when events popped up out of nowhere, when we had to run from one building to another with barely any rest. You still showed up, even if your house was far, even if your body was tired, even if the weather wasn’t on our side.
You captured moments, made people feel seen, and gave meaning to the smallest details. And you didn’t ask for recognition — you simply did what needed to be done, and you did it with heart.
Barney once said, “𝘞𝘩𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘥𝘰 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦, 𝘪𝘵’𝘴 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘭𝘦𝘨𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘢𝘳𝘺 𝘶𝘯𝘭𝘦𝘴𝘴 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘧𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘴𝘦𝘦 𝘪𝘵.” And we were here to witness it — the late nights, the technical hiccups, the creative rushes, the laughter in between. It wasn’t always perfect, but it was real. It was honest. And it was legendary because you were part of it.
We’ve always worked in the moment — live coverage, real-time adjustments, no time for rewrites. And that’s also how this goodbye feels. Sudden. Fast. But meaningful.
Robin once said, “𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘧𝘶𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘴𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘺, 𝘣𝘶𝘵 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘤𝘢𝘯’𝘵 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘳𝘶𝘯 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘪𝘵’𝘴 𝘧𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘪𝘢𝘳.” And while it’s sad to let go of this chapter, we know you’re ready for what’s next. You’ve already proven how strong, passionate, and reliable you are. And whatever comes after this, we know you’ll carry those same values forward.
You’re graduating, but your presence stays with us. In every shoot we do, every layout we polish, every small thing we learned from you — you’ll be there, too.
From all of us still here, thank you for the patience, the guidance, the small talks during long days, and for choosing to stay, even when it was hard.
You’ve made your mark. You’ll always be part of our story.
With love and pride,
Infocus Family

title.en: Happy Independence Day

description.en: Celebrating the bravery and sacrifices of Filipinos during the revolution.

content.en: When the revolution broke out in 1896, Filipinos risked their lives to fight for freedom from the colonizers. One of the key figures in the Philippine Revolution who offered shelter, food, and medical aid to the Katipunan revolutionaries was Melchora Aquino, known as Tandang Sora. She was also honored with the titles “Mother of the Katipunan” and “Grand Woman of the Revolution.” As a supporter of the Katipunan, she provided them with rice and cattle for food, as spotted in the photo. #RP612fic

tagline.en: Engineering the future, building the nation

history.en: The College of Engineering has been a cornerstone of Marinduque State College since its inception, providing quality education in various engineering disciplines. Established in 1995, it has evolved to meet the changing needs of the industry and society.

goals.en: To produce highly skilled engineers who can contribute to national development and innovation.

history.en: The College of Arts and Sciences has been integral to the cultural and intellectual development of Marinduque State College since its establishment in 1990. It offers a diverse range of programs that promote critical thinking and creativity.

goals.en: To nurture creative thinkers and lifelong learners who can contribute to society through the arts and sciences.

content.en: The College of Arts and Sciences invites you to the annual Art Exhibition showcasing student artworks.

history.en: The College of Industrial Technology has been a vital part of Marinduque State University since its establishment, offering programs that equip students with the skills needed for the dynamic industrial environment.

goals.en: To produce highly skilled technicians who can contribute to the industrial development of the province.

content.en: Save the date for the Tech Innovators Conference 2025, featuring industry leaders and experts.

history.en: The College of Business and Management has been a leader in business education in Marinduque since its establishment, providing students with the knowledge and skills needed to excel in the business world.

goals.en: To develop future business leaders who can drive economic growth and innovation.

title.en: Business Leaders Forum 2025

content.en: Don't miss the Business Leaders Forum 2025, a gathering of top executives and entrepreneurs.

title.en: New MBA Program Launch

content.en: We are thrilled to announce the launch of our new MBA program designed for aspiring business leaders.

history.en: The College of Education has been shaping the future of education in Marinduque since its establishment, providing quality training for aspiring teachers.

goals.en: To produce competent and compassionate educators who can inspire and lead the next generation.

title.en: Education Summit 2025

content.en: Join us at the Education Summit 2025 to explore the future of education.

outcomes.outcome: Demonstrate broad and coherent knowledge and understanding in the core areas of information systems, including systems analysis and design, database management, networking, and information security. Apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to analyze complex information systems problems and develop effective solutions. Design, implement, and manage information systems that meet organizational needs while adhering to ethical standards and legal requirements. Communicate effectively with diverse audiences, both orally and in writing, to convey technical information related to information systems. Work collaboratively in teams to achieve common goals in the development and implementation of information systems projects. Demonstrate a commitment to lifelong learning by staying current with emerging technologies and trends in the field of information systems.

Define and access information needs; assess and organize information and knowledge. Produce, share and utilize information and knowledge. Communicate in different formats and platforms (print, broadcast, and online). Prepare communication/media plan. Conduct communication and media research and evaluation. Develop and produce communication materials in different formats and platforms. Demonstrate communication management and leadership skills. Develop entrepreneurial capabilities. Adhere to ethical standards and practices. Know and practice rights and responsibilities and accountabilities in the communication profession. Demonstrate a development orientation in communication work. Apply communication theories/models, principles, practices, and tools in development work.

title.en: Online Enrollment Period for JHS (Grade 7-10) and Incoming 1st Year College Students

description.en: Online enrollment for returning college students, transferees, second coursers, CTPE, and graduate students.
description.fil: Online enrollment para sa mga dating kolehiyo, transferee, nagbabalik na estudyante, kumukuha ng ikalawang kurso, CTPE, at mga mag-aaral sa graduate studies.

description.en: Filing of letter request for SPC or Petition Class and evaluation of related documents.
description.fil: Pagsusumite ng liham ng kahilingan para sa SPC o Petition Class at pagsusuri ng mga kaugnay na dokumento.

title.en: Submission of Requirements (hard copy) of New Students to ARO
title.fil: Pagsusumite ng mga kinakailangang dokumento (hard copy) ng mga bagong estudyante sa ARO.

description.en: Submission of hard copy documents of new students to the ARO.
description.fil: Pagbibigay ng hard copy ng mga dokumento ng bagong estudyante sa ARO.

title.en: Filing of Application for Midyear (November) 2025 Graduation / 70th Commencement Exercises
title.fil: Pagsusumite ng aplikasyon para sa Midyear (Nobyembre) 2025 Pagtatapos / ika-70 na Seremonya ng Pagtatapos.

description.en: This process involves submitting an application to participate in the Midyear 2025 Graduation and the 70th Commencement Exercises, ensuring eligibility and preparation for the ceremony.
description.fil: Ang prosesong ito ay kinapapalooban ng pagsusumite ng aplikasyon upang makilahok sa Midyear 2025 Pagtatapos at ika-70 na Seremonya ng Pagtatapos, upang matiyak ang karapatan at kahandaan para sa programa.

title.en: First Day of Service of Faculty
title.fil: Unang Araw ng Paglilingkod ng mga guro

description.en: The first day when faculty members begin their duties for the academic year.
description.fil: Ang unang araw kung kailan nagsisimula ang mga guro sa kanilang tungkulin para sa akademikong taon.

title.en: Faculty In-Service Training
title.fil: Pagsasanay ng mga guro sa Serbisyo

description.en: A training program designed for faculty members to enhance their knowledge, skills, and professional development.
description.fil: Isang programa ng pagsasanay na inilaan para sa mga guro upang mapahusay ang kanilang kaalaman, kasanayan, at propesyonal na pag-unlad.

title.en: First Day of Regular Classes and F2F Student Orientation
title.fil: Unang Araw ng Regular na Klase at F2F na Pagsasanay para sa mga Estudyante

description.en: A day marking the start of regular classes alongside face-to-face orientation for students to guide them on policies, programs, and expectations for the academic year.
description.fil: Isang araw ng pagsisimula ng mga regular na klase kasabay ng harapang oryentasyon para sa mga estudyante upang gabayan sila sa mga patakaran, programa, at mga inaasahan sa akademikong taon.

title.en: Last day of Adding/Changing of Subjects
title.fil: Huling Araw ng Pagdaragdag/Pagbabago ng mga Paksa

description.en: The last day for students to add or change their subjects for the current semester.
description.fil: Ang huling araw para sa mga estudyante na magdagdag o magpalit ng kanilang mga asignatura para sa kasalukuyang semestre.

title.en: Last Day of Dropping of Subjects
title.fil: Huling Araw ng Pag-drop ng mga Asignatura

description.en: The last day for students to drop or withdraw from their subjects for the current semester.
description.fil: Ang huling araw para sa mga estudyante na mag-drop o mag-withdraw ng kanilang mga asignatura sa kasalukuyang semestre

title.en: Last Day of Settlement of Admission Requirements of New Students enrolled during the 1st Semester AY 2025-2026
title.fil: Huling Araw ng Pagsasaayos ng mga Kinakailangang Dokumento ng mga Bagong Estudyanteng Nag-enroll sa Unang Semestre ng TA 2025-2026.

description.en: The last day for new students to submit and have their admission requirements processed for enrollment in the first semester of the academic year 2025-2026.
description.fil: Ang huling araw para maisumite at maproseso ng mga bagong estudyante ang kanilang mga kinakailangang dokumento para sa enrollment sa unang semestre ng taong akademiko 2025-2026.

title.en: Midterm Examinations
title.fil: Pagsusulit sa Kalagitnaan ng Termino

description.en: An exam conducted midway through the semester to assess students’ knowledge and progress on the topics covered.
description.fil: Isang pagsusulit na isinasagawa sa kalagitnaan ng semestre upang masukat ang kaalaman at pag-unlad ng mga estudyante sa mga napag-aralang aralin.

title.en: Submission of Final Manuscript (Thesis/Dissertation) of Candidates for Midyear (November) 2025 Graduation
title.fil: Pagsusumite ng Pinal na Manuskripto (Thesis/Dissertation) ng mga Kandidato para sa Midyear (Nobyembre) 2025 Pagtatapos.

description.en: The process of submitting the final copy of the thesis or dissertation by candidates for the Midyear (November) 2025 Graduation as part of their graduation requirements.
description.fil: Ang proseso ng pagsusumite ng pinal na kopya ng thesis o dissertation ng mga estudyanteng kandidato para sa Midyear (Nobyembre) 2025 Pagtatapos bilang bahagi ng kanilang mga graduation requirements.

title.en: Final Examinations
title.fil: Pangwakas na Pagsusulit

description.en: An examination conducted at the end of the semester to assess the students' overall knowledge and understanding of all topics covered.
description.fil: Isang pagsusulit na isinasagawa sa pagtatapos ng semestre upang sukatin ang kabuuang kaalaman at pag-unawa ng mga estudyante sa lahat ng paksang tinalakay.

title.en: End of 1st Semester AY 2025-2026 and Last Day of Completion of Incomplete (INC.) Rating obtained during the 1st Semester AY 2024-2025 (for the subjects without advanced subjects)
title.fil: Pagtatapos ng Unang Semestre ng AY 2025-2026 at Huling Araw ng Pagtatapos ng Incomplete (INC.) na Marka na nakuha noong Unang Semestre ng AY 2024-2025 (para sa mga asignaturang walang kasunod na advanced na asignatura).

description.en: The end of the 1st semester of AY 2025-2026 and the final deadline for students to complete their Incomplete (INC.) grades obtained during the 1st semester of AY 2024-2025, applicable only to subjects without advanced courses.
description.fil: Ang araw ng pagtatapos ng unang semestre ng AY 2025-2026 at ang itinakdang huling araw para sa mga estudyante na makumpleto ang kanilang Incomplete (INC.) na marka mula sa unang semestre ng AY 2024-2025, para lamang sa mga asignaturang walang kasunod na advanced na kurso.

title.en: Semestral Break
title.fil: Pansamantalang Bakasyon sa Pagitan ng mga Semestre

description.en: A break period for students and faculty after the end of a semester and before the start of the next one.
description.fil: Isang panahon ng pahinga para sa mga estudyante at guro matapos ang pagtatapos ng semestre bago magsimula ang susunod na semestre.

title.en: Online Admissiion of Transferees, Returning and Graduate Students for 2nd Semester AY 2025-2026
title.fil: Online Admission ng mga Transferee, Nagbabalik na Estudyante at mga Mag-aaral sa Antas Gradwado para sa Ikalawang Semestre ng AY 2025-2026

description.fil: Isang online na proseso ng aplikasyon at pagtanggap para sa mga transferee, nagbabalik na estudyante, at mga mag-aaral sa antas gradwado para sa ikalawang semestre ng taong akademiko 2025-2026.

title.en: Last Day of Online Posting of Grades of Faculty
title.fil: Huling Araw ng Online na Paglalathala ng mga Grado ng mga Guro

description.fil: Ang itinakdang huling araw para sa mga guro na mag-post ng mga opisyal na grado ng mga estudyante sa online system para sa kasalukuyang semestre.

title.en: Submission of Official Grading Sheets(Hard Copies) to ARO

description.en: The process of submitting the printed official grading sheets by faculty to the Academic Records Office (ARO) as part of the documentation of students' grades.
description.fil: Ang proseso ng pagsumite ng naka-print na opisyal na grading sheets ng mga guro sa Academic Records Office (ARO) bilang bahagi ng dokumentasyon ng mga grado ng estudyante.

title.en: Deliberation of Final List of Candidates for Midyear / November 2025 Graduation / 70th Commencement Exercises by Department/College/Graduate School

description.fil: Isang proseso ng masusing pagsusuri at pag-apruba ng bawat departamento, kolehiyo, o graduate school sa pinal na listahan ng mga estudyanteng kandidato para sa pagtatapos sa Midyear / Nobyembre 2025 at sa ika-70 na Seremonya ng Pagtatapos.

title.en: Presentation of Final List of Candidates for Midyear / November 2025 Graduation / 70th Commencement Exercises before the Academic Council

description.fil: A formal presentation of the final list of student candidates for the Midyear / November 2025 Graduation and the 70th Commencement Exercises before the Academic Council for review and final approval.

title.en: Marinduque State University Joins Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2025

description.en: MARSU has been officially listed in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings for 2025, marking a significant milestone in its academic journey.

content.en:
MarSU earns global recognition for its commitment to sustainable and inclusive development
Boac, Marinduque, Philippines Marinduque State University (MarSU), under the leadership of Prof. Dr. Diosdado P. Zulueta, proudly makes its debut in the Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings 2025, marking a historic milestone not only for the institution but also for the Province of Marinduque and the MIMAROPA Region.
The THE World University Rankings, established in 2010, is one of the most prestigious global performance assessments for higher education institutions. It evaluates universities based on five key pillars: teaching, research environment, research quality, industry engagement, and international outlook. The ranking aims to provide transparency and insights for students, educators, and policymakers across the globe.
MarSU’s inclusion in this global list is a testament to its growing influence and commitment to academic excellence, research innovation, and global relevance. Most significantly, the university’s placement reflects its consistent efforts in advancing the United Nations’ 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)—from promoting quality education, gender equality, and climate action, to building partnerships that empower local and international communities.
This achievement affirms MarSU’s unwavering vision to be a transformative and globally engaged university that fosters inclusive development and sustainable impact. As it joins the ranks of the world’s recognized institutions, MarSU remains steadfast in its mission to shape future leaders who will contribute meaningfully to a better world
